div.div: How to add SpecFlow into your project
In order for the Ide to read your tests as BDD it needs a plug in named SpecFlow
To run your test you need steps to be followed. In the future files you will write down your steps. Every web page in the given web site needs a separte feature file
In order to perform an automation test we need locators for the Selenium to perform actions on
How to find locators by Id
Locators can be found with many possible ways. One of them is by Id which is the most reliable one.
How to find locators by Class Name
Locators can be found with many possible ways. One of them is by class name which is the most reliable one after id.

h2.span: How to add SpecFlow into your project

div.p: In order for the Ide to read your tests as BDD it needs a plug in named SpecFlow

section.p: Here you will learn how to add SpecFlow to your project

li.span: Open Visual Studio
Go to Extensions
Then go to Manage Extensions
Choose online
In the search box type SpecFlow
Hit the download button to begin the installation process

div.p: To run your test you need steps to be followed. In the future files you will write down your steps. Every web page in the given web site needs a separte feature file

section.p: You will learn how to create feature files

li.span: Create a sepate folder for the feature files in the project
Click with the right button of the mouse on the folder
Choose new item
Navigate to SpecFlow
Choose the top option
Name the file in the name field
Click on Save

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: In order to perform an automation test we need locators for the Selenium to perform actions on

section.p: In this topic we gonna found out how to create locators

li.span: Create a class named after the web page you are on ( every page of the web site must have separte class)
Create a variable as a private of type IWebElement
Name the variable

h2.span: How to find locators by Id

div.p: Locators can be found with many possible ways. One of them is by Id which is the most reliable one.

section.p: You will find out how to find locators by id

li.span: Create a locator
Go to the dom in the web site and search for the id of the given web element
Use lambda => after the locator's name
Use the command driver.FindBy(By.id()) after the lambda
Put the id into the By.id brackets as a string

h2.span: How to find locators by Class Name

div.p: Locators can be found with many possible ways. One of them is by class name which is the most reliable one after id.
div.section: You will find out how to find locators by class name

li.span: Create a locator
Go to the dom in the web site and search for the class name of the given web element
Use lambda => after the locator's name
Use the command driver.FindBy(By.className()) after the lambda
Put the class into the by.className brackets as a string
